text: That did work! Thanks for the help man!!
<@U6GNQ7JBU> Fantastic! Thanks
Is there any method to get JSON data from external url to HubL variable?
You cannot pass variables from JavaScript to HubL. You can use query parameters with a page load but that's not ideal for most situations and lengthy json in a url is not a good idea
Hi, why a Repeatable Group field in a module (without elements) return 4 as result of {{ module.section|length }}?
..because it contain the 4 internal elements with = NULL
.. {{ item.section[0]|length }} return 0 when the Repeatable Group Field is empty.
Is there a way to customize the default "post-listing" email module so you can pull recent posts with featured image and title? by default just a bulleted list
Has anyone figured a way to to reach product library using HubL?
The only context that I know of <@UFC6BLEAV> is in a deal workflow email in an `email_each` loop and that’s really `line_items` and not products

Thanks <@UFBNA9K9A>! 

Unfortunately not our use case.

We want to highlight ‘featured products’ on blog posts.

Something HubSpot should consider as they continue to build out Ecom functionality

I agree with the fact more products related info should be accessible via HubL. that said I haven’t personally had to do anything with products in HubSpot yet. just seen a lot of people talk about it and it seems like a very useful thing

<@U7SL518D6> consider the use case above, 

There are already modules in HS marketplace for ‘featured products’ but these are static (i.e inputted into the template/module)

With a product library of 5000-6000 and prices constantly changing or products being discontinued it would be AMAZING if this was simply linked to product library.

Also, for cross-sell and upsell the product library should have a self join so we don’t need to maintain two versions of the same information
I completely understand and echo your point
:dancer::skin-tone-2: :man_dancing:
<@UFC6BLEAV> Like this <https://www.americantorchtip.com/products>
<@U38EZFVFE> is this using HubDB or Product Library?
Hubdb
I found this for products <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/products/get-all-products>
but be careful cause it needs your api key to work
<@UFC6BLEAV> do you mean Product Library as in <https://app.HubSpot.com/settings/<HID>/sales/products>
<@U6W3H6YN8> yes :)
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/en/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-functions#crm-object> :smile_cat:
Thanks <@U6W3H6YN8>. I’ll give that a shot today.

This is why my preferred approach is HubL :slightly_smiling_face:

Thanks for following up and helping with research though
